instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..
definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Hello everyone.

I have this motherboard that takes time to turn on. I suspect it may be bios.

<CHIP>U6100</CHIP> voltages

1: 3.3v
2: 3.2v
3: 3.3v
4:GND
5: 0.56mv
6: 000.1mv
7: 3.3V
8: 3.3V

My question is, are these values ok?

I haven't tried another bios yet.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: We have clean ME BIOSes posted on the forum...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Do you recommend me to change the bios?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
You didn't explain too much about the problem.
Machine turns on, but stays long time in progress bar, or what exactly happens?

If you have any other MacBook working board, do you get different voltages on the BIOS chip?
I assure you no.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
exactly. the machine turns on but stays in the progress bar.

To my bad luck I don't have another board to test, but I'm pretty sure those voltages are missing. At least one.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Why do you assume missing voltage, if you don't know the behavior of working BIOS???

[URL unfurl="true"]https://drive.google.com/file/d/1mTP3wgNUbRhxvjZ8Qfo4Mq8Sg4ENmVbw/view?usp=sharing[/URL]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Already compare with another plate of the same number. And those voltages are present

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: When the board boots, pins 5 & 6 of BIOS chip will have 0V!!!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Hello friend, I already loaded bios, with the programmer I have, lower the circuit and mount it on the table.
The problem remains the same, without image, Sinn Backlight and without sound, may the <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> be damaged?
The <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> of this MacBook is a 25q64FV Windobond I have another Mac with the same IC, but it is a MacBook Pro, <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, I suppose the IC can serve me only by programing it true?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: It stays at 461mA and goes down to 25mA then 30mA and I reach 440mA and then 480mA and the fan is at full

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: I already changed the bios ic, reprogrammed the bios, and it keeps doing the same error, without image, backlight and sound

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
"The problem remains the same, without image, Sinn Backlight and without sound"
???
You've said the machine stuck in progress bar before...
